getTokenPrice(address).details: gets the price of a Token. It will return the Token's specific price.

params.tokenContract: is the address of the Token contract

returns.price: of the Token in weis of dollars. 10^18 => $ 1.00 USD

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setSingleTokenPrice(address,uint256).details: set the price for a single Token

params.price: price of the Token in weis of dollars. 10^18 => $ 1.00 USD
params.tokenContract: is the address of the Token contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

version().details: gets the version of the contract

getTokenPrice(address).notice: that the price is for the whole token and not of its atomic unit. This means that if an ERC20 with 18 decimals has a price of 2 dollars, then its atomic unit would be 2/10^18 USD. 999_999_999_999_999_999 = 0xDE0B6B3A763FFFF, 1_000_000_000_000_000_000 = DE0B6B3A7640000

setSingleTokenPrice(address,uint256).notice: that the token is the whole token and not its atomic unit. This means that if an ERC20 with 18 decimals has a price of 2 dollars, then its atomic unit would be 2/10^18 USD. 999_999_999_999_999_999 = 0xDE0B6B3A763FFFF, 1_000_000_000_000_000_000 = DE0B6B3A7640000
